newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia rubber ends week mixed in quiet trade.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia rubber ends week mixed in quiet trade.

text.p: Malaysian rubber prices ended mixed after a quiet day, with news that International Natural Rubber Organisation (INRO) is set to intervene in the market to stabilise prices having no immediate impact on the market, dealers said.
"There was little happening in the market today," a dealer at a trading firm said.
Some scattered deals to China and Middle East were transacted for July SMR 20 rubber.
But no tonnages and prices were available.
The market continued to see more shortcovering by European buyers ahead of the summer holidays, and dealers expect more covering next week for forward positions.
Prices were expected to hover steadily next week, dealers said.
At the close, July RSS Ones buyer was unchanged at 282.50 cents a kg and July SMR 20 buyer eased a cent to 258.50 cents.
Dealing houses offered SMR 20 at 258-260 cents, SMR CV at 328-329, SMR L at 307-309, SMR 5 at 270-272 and latex rubber at 224-225.
